data.title: Babyface
data.meta_description: Babyface artist page: interviews, features and/or performances archived at NPR Music
data.text:
Babyface: Tiny Desk Concert

The singer, songwriter and producer brought his timeless love songs to the Tiny Desk.

On 'Girls Night Out,' Babyface collaborates with a new generation of women artists

In the 1990's few producers matched Babyface's success. From Whitney Houston to TLC to Boyz II Men, his touch led to massive hits. NPR's A Martinez talks to him about his new album.

On 'Girls Night Out,' Babyface collaborates with a new generation of women artists

Listen · 7:03 7:03

Ranked: SNL's 18 Musical Performances From The 2019-20 Season

It is vital that we reflect on the most recent season of Saturday Night Live and mean-spiritedly rank its 18 featured musical acts from worst to best.

I'll Give My Love If You Return It To Me: Babyface And The Bonds Of Collaboration

The songwriter who defined '90s R&B has been getting his due lately, but more than his melodies, it's his ability to understand collaborators — so often women — that marks him as an icon of the genre.

'Waiting To Exhale: Original Soundtrack Album' Is A Transcendent Celebration Of Womanhood

The album, with its star-studded tracklist featuring only women, isn't just one of the most successful soundtracks ever made, but a beloved, standalone R&B album.

Jay Z Is The First Rapper To Be Elected To Songwriters Hall Of Fame

Shawn Carter joins Swedish hit factory Max Martin, Motown co-founder Berry Gordy, The Time's Jimmy Jam and Terry Lewis and more.

Babyface Remembers Slow Dancing, Old Crushes And His First Song

The R&B hitmaker picked up guitar in sixth grade, just in time for an early lesson in heartbreak. He speaks with Rachel Martin about his new album and what his late mother taught him about love.

Babyface Remembers Slow Dancing, Old Crushes And His First Song

Listen · 7:38 7:38

NPR Music's 25 Favorite Albums Of 2014 (So Far)

A selection of 25 deep, joyful, rewarding albums from every genre, out of every corner of the world, from the first six months months of 2014, picked by NPR Music.

Vengo

3:12
